WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The sun that gives life is our very own star (which we happen to call the sun). Of course, all the other stars are probably giving life to other planets as well.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine all sorts of stars all around the universe giving life to planets as suns. These are all the stars you see in the sky and there are billions of them. I hope you don't feel overwhelmed by how minuscule we really are when you look up at all of them.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This star (the sun) and all of the others are yours to protect with your trusty saber (ã›ã„). If you could protect your land from the West, then you can certainly defend the stars too!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Now you're soaring through between the stars, swinging your saber through the silence of space, and... wait. No that was a dream. You roll over and pat your saber. The two of you are ready just in case the stars need your help.

(æ˜Ÿ, xing=hsing star) When we see this character, it shows the green plants (å±®) coming up from the earth (åœŸ), which symbolizes full of life (ç”Ÿ, sheng, to live, life), and stars scattered around it (æ™¶, jing, brilliant; crystal). In ancient dictionary, it was explained that â€œstars are spirits of all living thingsâ€. According to the explanations, the stars or the constellations are related to the spirits of living things. Why did the ancient people connect the stars with the spirit?,Therefore, the reason there is the character (ç”Ÿ, sheng, to live, life), which means life/birth (æ˜Ÿ, xing=hsing star), is because people thought that Heaven (å¤©, tian=tâ€™ien, Heaven, God) was the origin of all living things.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The word " star " in Jiajin seal script starts with " crystal " and " sheng " sound. " Jing " is like a list of stars, with oracle bone inscriptions " sheng " as sound symbol. The original meaning is stars. The " crystal " and " star " in the oracle bone inscriptions are like stars, and the word " star " from the sound of " sheng " is used to express the clearness of the sky (Yang Shuda, Rao Zongyi, Li Xueqin). "Collection" 15625 reversed: "Gengchen Star (Sunny)", which means Gengchen's weather is clear this day. "Han Fei. Shuo Lin: "Rain ten days, Ye Xing." "Suo Yuan. "Zhiwu" is "Ye Qing"

" Qing " ancient works "å¤", "Shuowen": "å¤, rain and night except for the stars. From the evening, sound." It means that the rain stops at night and the stars appear. The stars can only be seen when the sky is clear, so " star " implies " clearness ". Duan Yucai's note: "Those who are turning, the rain stops and there is no cloud. The ancients, the turnings, and the essence are all clear today. And the "Poem" is the star." "Poetry. The wind. "Ding Zhi Fang Zhong": "Xing Yan Su drive" means driving in the morning on a sunny day, and " star " means " clear ", same as Oracle.

Bronze writing is used as the name of the person, Lu Bogui: "Father Lu Boxing is the name of Yao Zhongxian Baogui."

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period and the silk script of the Han Dynasty were borrowed as " fishy ", "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Rec. 53 of the Japanese Book A Type: "Star Stink", which means "fishy smell". "Mawangdui Silk Book. The third line of the Book of Fetal Delivery: "Don't eat Xinxing (fishy)", which means not to eat spicy and fishy things. It is also used as the original meaning to indicate the stars, "Shangbo Zhushu III. "Zhong Gong" Jane 19: "Sun, Moon and Star (Chen)". "Mawangdui Silk Book. The 170th line of the Old Unknown Book before the First Volume of Lao Zi: "Stars and Clouds". Line 65: "There are numbers of sun, moon and stars, and the time of heaven and earth."

"Said Wen": "æ›, the essence of all things, the upper is the star. From the crystal, the sound is born. One said: the pictogram, from the å›—. The ancient å›— is in the re-annotation, so it is the same as the day. ğ »– (ğ¤¯¢), ancient prose. Star , æ› or province." Radicals: æ—¥, ç”Ÿ  (sun, life)
Meaning Mnemonic
The sun that gives life is our very own star (which we happen to call the sun). Of course, all the other stars are probably giving life to other planets as well.
Imagine all sorts of stars all around the universe giving life to planets as suns. These are all the stars you see in the sky and there are billions of them. I hope you don't feel overwhelmed by how minuscule we really are when you look up at all of them.
Reading Mnemonic
This star (the sun) and all of the others are yours to protect with your trusty saber (ã›ã„). If you could protect your land from the West, then you can certainly defend the stars too!
Now you're soaring through between the stars, swinging your saber through the silence of space, and... wait. No that was a dream. You roll over and pat your saber. The two of you are ready just in case the stars need your help.
